events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of May 1st, involving a collision with another vehicle at a traffic intersection.
After initial review, the claim was categorized as an 'Auto Accident' based on the description of the vehicle collision and damage details provided.
An insurance agent was promptly assigned to handle the claim and will be the point of contact for all customer inquiries going forward.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim to the customer, confirming that the process has officially begun.
The agent requested all necessary documents including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a copy of the driver's license.
The customer submitted all requested documents on time, including high-resolution images of the damage and the official accident report.
An investigation team was assigned to review the submitted documents and gather further details about the collision circumstances.
The investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and that all damage estimates are consistent with the reported collision.
A settlement offer was prepared and proposed to the customer covering vehicle repairs and rental car reimbursement costs.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the promptness and clarity of communication.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company with all terms agreed upon as per the proposed settlement.
The insurance payment was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account covering the agreed amount for car repairs and related expenses.
The claim file was officially closed after the full settlement payment was received and acknowledged by the customer.
The claim documents and all correspondence were securely archived following closure to maintain accurate records for future reference.
